so industry 5.0 is a common term in the industrial lexicon it refers to the integration of Advanced Technologies
into the manufacturing and production process Technologies such as artificial
intelligence Edge Computing aerobotics big data analytics and internet of
things or industrial internet of things which plays a crucial role in the industry 5.0 by by enabling devices and
systems to communicate with each other in real time and by that leading to better decision making and Improvement
improved efficiency there are different types of industrial
iot devices including sensors meters controllers hmis and different network
devices a very common and popular one is industrial solar routers and gateways
they're used to enable a secure remote access between Industrial Equipment in
remote sites over the solar Network to the control center they typically
featured with the rugged design to operate in industrial environments and they're supporting different industrial
protocols such as modbus and dnp3 usually they have a Wi-Fi functionality
and they have built-in security functionalities like ipsec VPN and firewall and another feature they
commonly have is the vendor cloud-based management platform for Remote Management of the devices
those platforms provided by the vendors as a service usually as a paid service users can create an account on the cloud
platform and register the devices under the account and remotely manage the
devices see their alerts and statistics operations like
configuration changes firmware upgrade reboot and others can be done over the
cloud platform without the need of the device owner to physically travel to each location
so doing our research we decided to focus on Industrial solar routers and gateways as our industrial iot device
for the research for three main reasons first they are very common on different
industrial sectors and critical infrastructure as a remote connectivity solution they can be found in substations water
utilities oil fields and Pipelines second According to some research more
than 4.5 million devices were shipped globally at during 2021 so they are
quite popular and three successful exploitation of the industrial solar routers and gateways by
attackers could have two potential impacts a local impact and the remote impact the local impact since the
industrial devices and Protocols are insecure by design an attacker with direct access to them can easily
manipulate and impact the process for example stop the old production in
oilfield and the remote impact leveraging the built-in VPN on the device if in use an attacker can use the
VPN credential in order to perform lateral movement to the other side of the VPN connection where the Escada

now a few recommendations for clients the first recommendation if you are not
using the cloud management feature validate that this feature is actually
disabled to prevent the device takeover if you are using the cloud management platform before you are connecting your
device for the first time to the internet register the device to your account so
if it will be already registered to another account you will be notified for that
and the third recommendation for our clients especially for industrial solar
routers and gateways with security features once the router is compromised through the cloud
the security features are useless okay the attacker can stop remove the
firewall and rules and manipulate the security features for example use the
VPN credentials in order to perform electoral movement attack to the other side of the VPN connection so I'm
suggesting to the clients to separate the security to a different device between the local network and the router
and use it only as a bridge to the internet a few recommendations for vendors add
additional secret to the registration here you can see that after we reported about this vulnerability to tell Tonica
they added additional layer of security to the registration a password that known only for the owner of the device
so if the attacker somehow collected the identifiers it cannot register the
device to either Cloud accounts the second one is initial for the
initial setup of default credentials especially the SMP Community stream if the device will be exposed to the
internet it will make the life very hard for attackers because search engines
like Showdown and said this is usually they are using the default Community strings for SNMP the public private and
admin so if the vendor will force changing the default command string
those search engine and won't be able to find the device
and the third recommendation for vendors is since the from a security perspective in
the industrial iot is not a regular iot devices and they're used in industrial
environments and therefore they should be more secured uh I'm suggesting to
vendors to create sort of a new cloud with limited features
so like firmware upgrade and reboot so users can choose whether they want a lot
of security a lot of features and by that the attack surface will be
increased and use a limited cloud with limited features only the features that
they need and it's a simple mathematics when you have limited features the
attack surface is lower so a few takeaways from this research
starting with the first one the cloud management feature is a big
supply chain risk so actually entering a third party into your network and this
third party is not only in your network this party is in thousands of networks
and if attackers decide to Target this specific company they can get access to
thousands of networks at once the second takeaway
uh is that users may not be aware that their devices
contain a cloud management feature and since this feature is by default
usually by default enabled the devices can be compromised so it's important to be aware what
features your the devices that you are using offer
and the third takeaway when you are designing a network and you decide
to use the same device for different purposes for example
use a security device with security features also as a Wi-Fi access points
and also as industrial solar routers with Cloud management it will lower the security of your
network so it's important to be aware for this it may be cheaper but it will lower the
